summary: This is a cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated November 9, 2020, transmitting discovery materials to the Metropolitan Detention Center for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center to whom discovery materials are being sent in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the Assistant United States Attorney who signed the letter transmitting discovery materials to the detention center for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the criminal case against Maxwell, and is responsible for transmitting discovery materials to her.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to the Metropolitan Detention Center for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell while she is incarcerated.
It confirms that as of November 9, 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.
The criminal case referenced is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
Audrey Strauss, as Assistant U.S. Attorney, was involved in the prosecution's discovery process.
The document demonstrates ongoing legal proceedings and discovery exchange in Maxwell's case in late 2020.
